list_definition.definition: a large black bird of the crow family.

list_ex_of_english: Thus raven created man and ordered the world.
A raven approached him, raised one of its wings, pushed up its beak, like a mask, and changed into a man.
The cormorants, the ravens, always exacted every penny that could be got out of the public purse.
Parts of the raven are used for various purposes.
A raven and his wife had two children.
The argument considers situations in which the total numbers or prevalences of ravens and black objects are unknown, but estimated.
The performance was preceded by a video interlude featuring snarling dogs and brooding ravens.
No specific evaluation of the effects on ravens of sheep carrion has been made.
